text.section: A managing general agent may not place business with an insurer or maintain loss reserves from which claims against an insurer may be paid unless a written contract is in force between the managing general agent and insurer.

section.section:
This subsection applies if:
the contract provides for a sharing of profits by the managing general agent; and
the managing general agent has the authority to determine the amount of interim profits by establishing loss reserves, controlling claims payments, or any other method.

Interim profits may not be paid to a managing general agent subject to this subsection:
until:
at least 1 year after the profits are earned, for property insurance business; or
at least 5 years after the profits are earned, for casualty insurance business; and
until the profits have been verified by the insurer under § 8-210 of this subtitle.
